archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Rogan Josh Lamb Shanks with Saffron Peas Pulao and Cucumber-Mint Kachumber
description: Fall-apart lamb shanks braised in a deep rogan josh gravy, paired with fragrant saffron peas basmati rice and a bright cucumber-mint kachumber. A centerpiece Indian feast with layered aromas and medium heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Pat dry 4 lamb shank pieces with paper towels and season with salt and black pepper.

Measure spices: 2 tsp turmeric powder, 2 tsp garam masala, 2 tsp ground cumin (or 2 tsp cumin seeds), 2 tsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 bay leaves, 4 green cardamom, 4 cloves, 1 small cinnamon stick.
For kachumber: dice 1 cucumber and 2 tomato; finely chop 1 small red onion, a handful of mint, and a handful of coriander; slice 1 chilies; cut 1 lemon in half.
For pulao: measure 1 pinch saffron, 1 cup peas, and 2.5 cups water; keep 2 tbsp oil ready.
cook_steps: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sear lamb shank on all sides until browned (8–10 minutes). Remove to a plate.
Lower to medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring, until deep golden (12–15 minutes).
Add garlic; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in turmeric powder, garam masala, ground cumin (or cumin seeds), coriander seeds, chili flakes, black pepper, bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon; toast 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes and 1 cup water; scrape up browned bits. Return lamb shank to the pot, spooning sauce over.
Bring to a gentle bubble, cover tightly, and transfer to the oven. Braise 2–2.5 hours, turning lamb once midway, until very tender.
30 minutes before lamb is done, start the saffron peas pulao: Warm 2.5 cups water; crumble saffron into it and let steep 5 minutes.
In a medium pot, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium. Add drained basmati rice; stir 1 minute to coat.
Pour in saffron water and 1 tsp salt; bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low. Cook 10 minutes.
Scatter peas over the rice (do not stir), cover, and cook 5 more minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes, then fluff gently.
Make kachumber: In a bowl combine cucumber, tomato, red onion, mint, coriander, and chilies. Squeeze lemon over, season with salt and black pepper, and toss.
Finish the lamb: Remove pot from oven. If sauce is thin, simmer uncovered on stovetop 5–10 minutes to thicken. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Serve lamb shanks with plenty of rogan josh gravy over saffron peas pulao. Add kachumber on the side for freshness.
instructions: Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Pat dry 4 lamb shank pieces with paper towels and season with salt and black pepper.
Slice 3 large onions thinly.
Crush 6 garlic cloves.

Measure spices: 2 tsp turmeric powder, 2 tsp garam masala, 2 tsp ground cumin (or 2 tsp cumin seeds), 2 tsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 bay leaves, 4 green cardamom, 4 cloves, 1 small cinnamon stick.
Open 1 can crushed tomatoes (about 400 g).
For kachumber: dice 1 cucumber and 2 tomato; finely chop 1 small red onion, a handful of mint, and a handful of coriander; slice 1 chilies; cut 1 lemon in half.
For pulao: measure 1 pinch saffron, 1 cup peas, and 2.5 cups water; keep 2 tbsp oil ready.
Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sear lamb shank on all sides until browned (8–10 minutes). Remove to a plate.
Lower to medium. Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook, stirring, until deep golden (12–15 minutes).
Add garlic; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in turmeric powder, garam masala, ground cumin (or cumin seeds), coriander seeds, chili flakes, black pepper, bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon; toast 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes and 1 cup water; scrape up browned bits. Return lamb shank to the pot, spooning sauce over.
Bring to a gentle bubble, cover tightly, and transfer to the oven. Braise 2–2.5 hours, turning lamb once midway, until very tender.
30 minutes before lamb is done, start the saffron peas pulao: Warm 2.5 cups water; crumble saffron into it and let steep 5 minutes.
In a medium pot, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium. Add drained basmati rice; stir 1 minute to coat.
Pour in saffron water and 1 tsp salt; bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low. Cook 10 minutes.
Scatter peas over the rice (do not stir), cover, and cook 5 more minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes, then fluff gently.
Make kachumber: In a bowl combine cucumber, tomato, red onion, mint, coriander, and chilies. Squeeze lemon over, season with salt and black pepper, and toss.
Finish the lamb: Remove pot from oven. If sauce is thin, simmer uncovered on stovetop 5–10 minutes to thicken. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Serve lamb shanks with plenty of rogan josh gravy over saffron peas pulao. Add kachumber on the side for freshness.

ingredients.quantity: 1 cup for braise + 2.5 cups for rice

final_ingredients.quantity: 1 cup for braise + 2.5 cups for rice
